intro: Limonium emporitanum, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its tall, spindly stems and clusters of blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found growing in coastal areas and saline soils. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is adapted to thrive in salty and well-drained environments. Limonium emporitanum is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
